p001.oneLiner: Yes, but... not yet. AI acts as a high-speed diagnostic assistant, not the ultimate bearer of ethical and legal accountability.
p001.summary.0: AI accelerates diagnostic data synthesis and imaging interpretation, reducing manual review time.
p001.summary.1: Clinical decision-making remains human-centric due to medical ethics, complex patient variables, and legal liability.
p001.summary.2: The role is shifting from data-gathering to high-level interpretation and compassionate patient management.

p002.oneLiner: Yes, but... not yet. AI can't replace the 'last meter' of care—the physical manipulation and emotional intuition at the bedside.

p002.summary.2: The role shifts from task execution to advanced patient advocacy and complex bedside judgment.
